unnormalised: Planning a trip? Don't forget your essentials! And by that, I don't just mean your toothbrush and that comfy pair of socks. We're talking about those super important travel identifiers that can make or break your journey. You know, the stuff that keeps the authorities happy and gets you where you need to go.
normalised: Planning a trip? Don't forget your essentials! And by that, I don't just mean your toothbrush and that comfy pair of socks. We're talking about those super important travel identifiers that can make or break your journey. You know, the stuff that keeps the authorities happy and gets you where you need to go.

unnormalised: First up, the big kahuna: your passport. It’s your golden ticket to international adventures, and its number (mine's something like X1234567) needs to be accurate on all your bookings. Double-check that expiry date, folks! Nothing worse than getting turned away at immigration because your passport expired last week. Trust me, a friend learned that the hard way!
normalised: First up, the big kahuna: your passport. It's your golden ticket to international adventures, and its number (mine's something like X one two three four five six seven) needs to be accurate on all your bookings. Double-check that expiry date, folks! Nothing worse than getting turned away at immigration because your passport expired last week. Trust me, a friend learned that the hard way!

unnormalised: Then there's the Aadhaar card. While it might not always be directly *needed* for travel in the same way a passport is, having a copy (both physical and digital) is super handy. Its number (e.g., 9876 5432 1012) can be useful for domestic travel verification or for booking activities. Plus, it's a solid form of ID to have on hand.
normalised: Then there's the Aadhaar card. While it might not always be directly *needed* for travel in the same way a passport is, having a copy (both physical and digital) is super handy. Its number (e.g., nine eight seven six five four three two one zero one two) can be useful for domestic travel verification or for booking activities. Plus, it's a solid form of I-D to have on hand.

unnormalised: And let's talk about tickets! Whether it’s a train ticket, plane ticket, or bus ticket, that PNR number (Passenger Name Record) is your lifeline. Keep it safe! Airlines and railways like IRCTC need it to locate your booking. And for flights, don't forget your booking reference, often a mix of letters and numbers like ABCDEFG. Screenshot everything, print it out, email it to yourself – do whatever it takes to avoid that frantic airport scramble.
normalised: And let's talk about tickets! Whether it's a train ticket, plane ticket, or bus ticket, that P-N-R number (Passenger Name Record) is your lifeline. Keep it safe! Airlines and railways like I-R-C-T-C need it to locate your booking. And for flights, don't forget your booking reference, often a mix of letters and numbers like A-B-C-D-E-F-G. Screenshot everything, print it out, email it to yourself – do whatever it takes to avoid that frantic airport scramble.

unnormalised: Don't forget your driver's license, either. If you're planning to rent a car or bike, you'll need it, and those numbers (like DL1234567890123) are going to be necessary for the rental agreement. In India, even for shorter trips, a valid DL is crucial. Make sure it's not expired!
normalised: Don't forget your driver's license, either. If you're planning to rent a car or bike, you'll need it, and those numbers (like D-L one two three four five six seven eight nine zero one two three) are going to be necessary for the rental agreement. In India, even for shorter trips, a valid D-L is crucial. Make sure it's not expired!

unnormalised: Lastly, if you’ve got a frequent flyer or loyalty card for airlines or hotels, keep those numbers handy too! You don’t want to miss out on those sweet, sweet reward points. So, before you pack your bags and dream of beaches or mountains, make a checklist of these identifiers. A little preparation goes a long way in ensuring a smooth and stress-free trip!
normalised: Lastly, if you've got a frequent flyer or loyalty card for airlines or hotels, keep those numbers handy too! You don't want to miss out on those sweet, sweet reward points. So, before you pack your bags and dream of beaches or mountains, make a checklist of these identifiers. A little preparation goes a long way in ensuring a smooth and stress-free trip!
